Text: EnronOnline HoustonLondon contactsHouston Here are the names of your EnronOnline Europe counterparts regarding the Tanker Freight Swap EnronOnline London Legal Robert Quick Phone should be able to answer your legal questions EnronOnline London Operations Arfan Aziz Phone should be able to tell you about how they calculate settlement prices that is should have access to backoffice formulas in the EOL system Please expedite the product approval process in any way that you can It has been over one week since the initial request and this Tanker Freight Swap product is not radically different from one that has been trading over in London for months Please contact me if you need any additional information Homer x

Re Tanker Freight Long Description Cc Looks good The product description looks fine for copying the shipping products that Scott Moncrieff is trading now in London Im a little concerned about the line Each calendar month during the term of the Transaction will be a Determination Period Is it flexible enough in changing determination periods from midmonth to midmonth As in June to July to represent a month Or will that just be another Long Description that we would have to draft for another product type Also what if we wanted to break up the determination periods into smaller increments than one month Let us say a week or week period instead of a full month May be something like Each calendar month during the term of the Transaction will be a Determination Period unless otherwise specified by the Effective Dates Thats my two cents Homer x From Mark Taylor on PM To Joe nronXGate Homer CT Carlos nronXGate cc Scott UEnronXGate Robert UEnronXGate Subject Tanker Freight Long Description Here is a draft of the US version Please let me know if it works for you

Re Tanker Freight Long DescriptionWhether or not the midmonth to midmonth deals are likely you should probably ask Scott Moncrieff or Joe King to answer that question I was just suggesting the possibility I do like the additional language that covers deals shorter than one month Each calendar month during the term of the Transaction will be a Determination Period provided that if the term of the Transaction is less than one calendar month the Determination Period shall be the term of the Transaction Perhaps we should proceed with the current Product Description and worry about the midmonth to midmonth description ifwhen we need it Homer From Mark Taylor on AM To Homer CT cc Carlos nronXGate Joe nronXGate Robert UEnronXGate Scott UEnronXGate Subject Re Tanker Freight Long Description Homer The problem with the language you suggest is that it will be triggered by any term that is longer than a month As far as I know we have never had a product that went from midmonth to midmonth Is that a real issue for us here We have language in a few products already that takes care of the second issue deals shorter than one month Each calendar month during the term of the Transaction will be a Determination Period provided that if the term of the Transaction is less than one calendar month the Determination Period shall be the term of the Transaction In some cases eg power swaps when the deal is for less than a month the payment dates are modified to fall at the beginning of the following month rather than days after the floating price is determinable That is a commercial call Just let me know how you want to handle that issue If midmonth to midmonth deals are likely let me know and I will come up with alternative language Mark Homer Lin AM To Mark CT Joe nronXGate Scott UEnronXGate cc Carlos nronXGate Robert UEnronXGate Subject Re Tanker Freight Long Description Mark Looks good The product description looks fine for copying the shipping products that Scott Moncrieff is trading now in London Im a little concerned about the line Each calendar month during the term of the Transaction will be a Determination Period Is it flexible enough in changing determination periods from midmonth to midmonth As in June to July to represent a month Or will that just be another Long Description that we would have to draft for another product type Also what if we wanted to break up the determination periods into smaller increments than one month Let us say a week or week period instead of a full month May be something like Each calendar month during the term of the Transaction will be a Determination Period unless otherwise specified by the Effective Dates Thats my two cents Homer x From Mark Taylor on PM To Joe nronXGate Homer CT Carlos nronXGate cc Scott UEnronXGate Robert UEnronXGate Subject Tanker Freight Long Description Here is a draft of the US version Please let me know if it works for you

RE Baltic Exchange changes Cc legal Looks fine by me Original Message From Meredith Kevin SentWednesday October AM ToLin Homer King Joe Taylor Mark E Legal CcGarner Kate SubjectBaltic Exchange changes Please review the proposed changesshown in blue to the Tanker Freight pro ducts as a result of the Baltic Exchange index changes If we receive your approval of the change we will make the change to the short and long desc ription this weekend Tkr Freight Swap BITR BDTI Dec WSmt A financial swap Transaction with Enron North America Corp under which the Seller pays a Floating Price and the Buyer pays a Fixed Price in each case in respect of the Notional Quantity per Determination Period Each calend ar month during the term of the Transaction will be a Determination Period provided that if the term of the Transaction is less than one calendar mo nth the Determination Period shall be the term of the Transaction The Fix ed Price shall be equal to the Flat Rate as defined below multiplied by t he percentage submitted by Counterparty via EnronOnline The Notional Quan tity per Determination Period shall be the volume submitted by Counterparty via EnronOnline The Floating Price shall be the Index The Payment Date shall be the fifth Business Day following the date on which the Floating Pr ice is determinable The term of the Transaction shall be from the Effective Date or start date to the Termination Date or end date The Effective Date or start date is Dec The Termination Date or end date is Dec The Index shall be the arithmetic average of the prices in the Determinatio n Period Such prices shall be calculated by multiplying the Flat Rate as defined below for the route known as tonnes loading Puerto La Cru z to Corpus Christi by the World Scale or WS under the heading The B altic International Tanker Route BITR Baltic Dirty Tanker Index BDTI R oute whenever published by The Baltic Exchange Limited within the Dete rmination Period The Flat Rate is the rate in US dollars per metric tonne as published by Worldscale Association London Limited and Worldscale Asso ciation NYC Inc in effect on the last day of the Determination Period f or the above mentioned route If for any reason the Baltic Exchange Limite d does not provide any prices during the Determination Period then the For ward Freight Agreement Brokers Association FFABA may be instructed by e ither Enron or Counterparty to form a panel to establish such price which will be binding on both Counterparty and Enron The price quoted on EnronOnline is World Scale or WS expressed as a pe rcentage of the Flat Rate The Contractual Currency will be US dollars The unit of measure against which the price is quoted shall be metric tonne s and the quantity shown shall be the number of LOTs per Determination Peri od each LOT being metric tonnes Kevin Meredith EnronOnline

Market Response Required for Cc kareno lists all customers that are going to receive a rejection letter from credit regarding their EnronOnline application If you want this process delayed so you can contact your customer or follow up with credit on behalf of your customer please contact Claudia Clark at x or Karen ODay at x If they are not contacted the rejection letter will be sent directly to the customer PA Company Name Bodine Electric Company Fuel Management Services Quest Energy LLC ScissorTail Energy LLC MDC Corp City of Hamilton Engage Energy America Corp Dominion Telecom Inc Natural Gas Supply Assn Gallo Glass SATRA Resources LLC Courik Management Inc United Aluminum Corporation Preussag Intl Steel Corp Oak Hill Coal Corporation Norsteel Corp Kentucky Natural Gas Corporation Internet Publishing Group Hunt Oil Company of Canada Inc Fair Oil Ltd by Fair Oil Company of Texas its sole General Partner Beartech Engineering LTD Homer x
